kingdome faith thus receiued brittaines continued flourished yeares vntill comming saxon pagan whilst brittaine thus receiued faith emperor rome infidel wherefore much trouble wos sought part wickednesse man nature inclined vnto hating truth louing lye regarding euill stead goodnesse receiuing deuill stead angell light choose king cruell seemed bee humble fauour truth hated backbited destroyer brittaine onely seculer men thus also byshoppes teacher therefore maruell people loose country defiled many wicked kinges among saxon good none almost fro first last either slain war murdred time comforted prouidence god first dane slaine landed ambushment king alfrids men lay garison owne safetie king shewed himselfe large men wiltshire somersetshire hampshire came vntill hee strong company king apparelled himselfe habit minstrell skilfull musicke entred tent dane lying eddingdon espied idlenesse heard much counsell sodainly nigh fell vpon dane slew great multitude subiects bearing manly uictories drew daily wonne winchester dane diuers townes forced seeke peace concluded vpon condition gutrum king christned would christned depart country king alfride king gutrums godfather baptisme named athelstan gaue norfolke suffolke part cambridgeshire northumberland christned would christned though departed realme diuerse time returne againe much spoile many part realme king alfride ouercame euer whole time dane land plagued warres pestilence murren beast king alwaies thanked god trouble soeuer hapned vnto hee raigned yeares sixe moneths died buried winchester euer bestowed eight houres day studie899 none england quicke vnderstanding elegant interpreting sent many learned men country instruct people first ordained certaine schooles diuerse art oxford franchised great liberty translated many bookes saxon tongue could faire meanes threat endeuoured stirre vp subiects learning preferred none great place except learned since time learning neuer extinguished realme edward sonne succeeded kingdom stephen fist nine pope rome nine yeare formosus bishop porti ax offended pope one woman afraid fled would returne excommunicated disgraded made sweare would neuer claime bishopricke againe remaine seculer man pope martine released oath restored bishopricke shortly obtained pap ci whereupon great controuersie held degradation oath could pope others held contrary absolued pope martin periury degradation sent arnulphus ayde marching rome would suffer enter hare comming neere citie host arnulphus followed maine cry valiant romaine feare cast themselues downe wals arnulphus little labour scaled wals gate citie thus obtained citie rome rescued pope beheaded aduersaries pope gratifie blessed crowned emperour formosus succeeded bonifacius sixt stephen sixt enuied formosus abrogated decree tooke vp body cut two finger right hand threwe tyber buried body layman sepulcre romanus succeeded repealed act stephen formosus theodorus second succeeded iohn tenth archbishoprick yorke one lanfranckus italian made archbishop canterbury betwixt grew contention giuing taking othe obedience king appeased bishop yorke builded minster yorke gaue possession thereto two archbishop came rome pale contreuersie renewed betwixt primacie pope disposed decide matter sent home haue matter determined mat er came king clergie windsor archbishop canterbury said since time austin conuerted land christianitie made archbishop canterbury primate england pop gregory primacie hath succeeded euer since yorke tooks christian faith thence reason bee subiect thereto bishop yorke answered britaines fi st possessor kingdome indured brutus cadwalader year vnder hundred two king receiued christian faith yeare christ time lucius king elutherius pope sent thither fagamus damianus preacher ordained realme bishop two archbishopes theonus archbishop london theodosius archbishop yorke continued yeares vntill saxon infidel subdued realme diuided seauen kingdome continued vntill gregory sent hither austin conuert realme made archbishop canterbury gregory purpose reduce new church saxon order old time amongst britaines vnder two metropolitaines london yorke yet hee gaue austen prerogatiue life time haue iurisdiction aboue bishop priest england dec ase london yorke ouersee charge willed distinction honour betwixt london yorke beene longest bishop place preferred upon decreed yorke subiect canterbury wheresoeuer canterbury would hold councell yorke bishop come thither obedient decree canterbury decease yorke come duer consecrate new archbishop yorke decease successor resort canterbury bishop canterbury appoint receiue consecration swearing obedience yeare king williams reigne another counsell holden london w ere decreed bishop yorke sit right hand canterbury againe bishop winchester placed aboue canon stead monkes part godly enterprise stopped lanfranke archbishop canterbury plucked downe old church canterbury builded vp new death pope hildebrand succeeded surnamed gregory sorcerer principal cause per urbation hath beene since church wrought feat setting vp displacing bishop listed setting emperours destroying matrimony vnder colour chasti ie chuch order pope quietly ruled vnder christian emperours defended first contemning authoritie emperor thrust himselfe pope vanting himselfe haue ecclesiasticall temporall sword committed christ full power binde loose lifted challenged dominion east west church set light king emperours raigned godamercie bishop prelate vnderlings kept awe suspending cursing chopping head irred vp warres releasing othes fidelitie due allegiance subiects prince scope tended chiefly practises abolish mariage priest translate authoritie emperiall vnto clergy appeared councell later n though pope name yet pope seeing king angry said saluo ordine suo would bona fide king told hee well content exception captious deceitfull hauing venome lurking vnder therefore required absolute grant answered would binde themselues manner king nobilitie little mooued king could get answer departed gret anger saluting bishop chester greatly rebuked fellowes changing exception next day king took archbishop mannors honor giuen lord chancellor long vnknowne bishop sayled normandie long bishop london followed craue fauour gaue counsell ioyne bishop least hee might sooner ouerthrowne thus meanes greatest number bishop reconciled vnto king onely archbishop remained stoutnes king saw feare threat could turne assaid gentlenesse would serue though many noble laboured exhort relent vnto king likewise archbishop yorke diuers clergie men bishoppes abbot especially chester besides owne house dayly called vpon man could perswade length vnderstanding danger might happen king displeasure onely himselfe clergy considering old kindnesse loue king towards time past content giue ouer vnto king request came king oxford reconciled himselfe wherevpon king receiued ch erefull countenance saying hee would haue ordinance confirmed open sight bishop noble king beeing clarem doune called peeres prelate requiring haue performed hee promised consenting obseruing grandfather ordinance proceeding archbishop drew back would hee would yet great teares intreaties perswasions bishop two templers desired knee teares threatenings imprisonment danger hee agree onely clause exception bona fide bishop set hand seales eating odie lord drinking blood consequently suspen th sinfull prelats ministration sacrament god doth suspend wicked declaration righteousnesse psal suspend prohibite ministry good thing offence sake new law term interdict forbid cleargy owne preferment exhaltation doth vndermine lay people multiply owne couetousnesse cloaketh malice prepareth way antichrist answere made article pri sufficeth saued christ head archb tell church cobh yea truely prior said doubt thereof christ said noli iudicare must iudge neighbor much lesse superior answered christ saith chapter ill tree knowne ill fruit false prophet workes saith iohn beleeue outward doings againe iohn iustum iudicium iudicate wee know thing true may iudge dauid saith recte iudicate filii hominum superioritie christ would meeke minister proud superiours doctor walden said make difference iudgements swift iudges alwaies learned schollars wickliffe answered iudgements preposterous prophet esay saith yee iudge ill good good ill therefore wayes god wayes god wayes wayes afore vertuous man wickliffe disdaine say god man knew despised doctrine neuer abstained f om sinne since trust haue done otherwise much grace could neuer finde glorious instruction doctor walden answered well mee many learned vertuous men teaching scripture example father plenteous grace amend vntill heard diuell preach hierome saith hee seeketh suspected master shall finde midday midday diuell answered pharises father ascribed christ miracle belzebub doctrine diuell naturall child haue still iudgement faithfull follower reproue vicious liuing must need hereticks cannot proue scripture doctor must proue said iudge neede goe act finde god law thus sit iudgement sentence euery man death doe daily haue ground scripture anna cayphas sat thus vpon christ vppon apostle ascention learned peter iohn lawyer said yes sir christ iudged iudas hee answered christ iudged hee iudged himselfe christ said indeed vnto woe vnto couetous act doth yet still many since venom shed church neuer followed christ neither perfit law archb meane venom cobh possession lordship cried angell ayre owne chronicle mention wo wo wo day venome shed church time almost bishop martyr since since time one hath put another one hath poysoned another one hath cursed another one hath slaine another done much mischiefes chronicle elleth men consider well christ meeke mercifull pope proude tyrant christ poore forgaue pope rich malitious manslayer rome neast antichrist neast proceedeth disciple prelats priest monk bodie pill frier taile couereth filthie part prior sayed alack r vncharitably spoken answered saying propet esayes hee preacheth lie tayle frier monk like pharises deuided outward apparell visage yee make deuision amongst people thus others naturall member antichrist hee said vnto woe vnto scribe pharises hypocrits shut kingdome heauen others enter selues suffer enter stoppe vp wayes tradition therefore houshold antichrist let god veritie haue passage fearing haue wickednesse reproued vaine flatterer vphold mischiefes suffer common people miserably bee seduced archb lady sir shall none preach diocesse make diuision amongst poore common cobh christ apostle accused sedition making yet peaceable men daniel christ prophesie troublous time shall come hath beene partly fulfilled dayes doings many haue slaine slay god fulfill maketh lawfull rich prohibited poore snare men lawes great summes money gathered germany breed priuate offence poore see themselues intangled snare onely haue thornes gospell christ often calleth rich haue receiued ecclesiasticall order free punishment secular magistrate doe presume sinning maintained therein principall estate cleargy attempt chastity matron uirgins gift flattering bring passe secret confession many otherwise would liue honest haue beene ouercome moued sinne often keepe wiues husband daughter father threatning fire sword require offend liuewise daily robbery murder accusing innocent burning rapine theft counterfeiting coyne besides many mischiefes bishop cannot openly punish except hee disgrade bound charter dare punnish therefore necessity iustice doth require said priuiledges cleargy bee abrogated haue iudgement layty offence christian excommunicated vaine prophane cause desire filthy luker whereby weake faith burdened brought dispaire man ought excommunicated heresie many holydaies husbandman haue scarce time gather fruit earth brought forth great trauell vpon holiday innumerable offence committed fight shed blood hollowed place interdicted cannot haue seruice done vntill cittizens great pompe expences haue caused consecrated charge redound vpon laity none suffragan baptize bel affirme bel baptized driue away euill spirit mpests whereupon many penitent intendeth ought intend touching question whether grace giuen sacrament god sendeth grace pleaseth either without pleaseth many lewd person receiue sacrament destitute grace confusion yet due receit sacrament god giueth grace askein opere imperf whether thing necessary saluation scripture chrysostome saith would haue true preacher god law swerue therefrom neither right hand left hee thereunto adde withdraw enterprise wiser god saint cyprian epistle ad cicilium fratrem teacheth ought heare christ regarding tradition men like doth diuers place agreeth well scripture called word saluation administration righteousnesse word truth rodde direction spirituall food spirituall sword ought fight withall temptation assault glostly enemy seed god kingdome heauen keyes power god light world law god wisedome testament euery one wordes giue sufficient matter argument following doctrine shal haue sufficient safeconduct come vnto inheritance promised though way mea ann xed vnto hundred eighteene psalme dauid saith word god true way verity euery man vanity lying christ saith euery one heareth word doth like one buildeth house vpon sure foundation none foundation paule would haue v follow one doctrine christ vnitie faith may bee perfect men carried euery winde doctrine brought vp slight wilines men tudie deceiue v touching question many thing beleeued vpon paine saluation scripture say lawes ordained ciuill regiment body lawes hurtfull faith charitie help ought keep onely feare punishment conscience sake although ordinance expressely scripture say nothing expressely scripture bee beleeued vpon necessitie saluation touching question purgatory whether soules departed torment purged say purgatory world fire tribulation christian shall passe paul saith liue godly christ shall suffer persecution purgatory doe reckon selfe stand god send well perseuere vnto honour purgatory doe know none neither proued place scripture august de ebrietate saith let man deceiue himselfe two place third knowne christ hath deserued raigne shall perish diuell booke de vanitate seculi saith know soule departed body incontinent good deed put paradice else throwne headlong dungeon hell sinnes scripture agreeth touching question whether martirs apostle confessor departed ought honored prayed vnto saint augustine booke de vera religione would haue worship men departed neuer good merindoles diuers others wandred wood mountain either sent gallies slaine many also died hunger fiue twenty hid themselues vnder rocke smothered burned kinde cruelty omitted notwithstanding diuers escaped came geneua place neere persecution callice martyrdome george bucket alias adam damlip adam damlip bin great papist chaplaine bishop rochester iournyed rome thinking haue found godly sincere know said priest said saue soule perceiue thou art heretick said priest within three day vertue warrant rom archbishop baylife two bishop men came suddenly house said browne carrying dish meat guest wife day churched layd hand carried canterburie kept fortie dayes time pitifully entreated warram archbishop fisher bishop rochester set barefooted vpon hote burning coales make denie faith bare vnkle short let tower continued liberty two yeares two day againe apprehended committed againe tower hee brought westminister hall arraigned charged felony treason put himselfe tried peeres discharged commended himselfe god prayer ended turned toward people certaine fatherly loue child said dearely beloued friend brought hether suffer death albeit neuer offended king word deed haue alwaies beene faithfull man vnto realme law condemned die testifie obedience owe vnto lawes come hither suffer death wherefore thanke god hath giuen time repentance might suddenly haue taken death could haue acknowledged god selfe would something put minde christian religion long authoritie alwaies diligently set forth reioice therein sith state christian religion commeth neere order primatiue church esteeme great benefit god vnto heartily exhorting thankefully imbrace set liuing doubt great calamitie follow upon word heard terrible noise beene great tempest aboue great deale gunpowder inclosed v tarried place knew happened heere euen officer high priest came take christ runne back fell ground great slaughter duke within yeares neuer many weeping eye one time people seeing sir anthony browne diligent seeke commoditie whole realme word people cryed said true praying king councell exhorting people obedience forgiuing enemy desiring forgiuenes offended praying beare witnes died faith christ head life lady mary king councell much trauell letter messenger reduce lady mary obedient con ormitie religion yet would reclaimed owne singuler opinion fixed vpon custome giue indifferent hearing said bishop madam come doe duety see grace also offer selfe preach sonday next please heare said pray make answere selfe know answere well enough must make answere shall answere doore church shall open come neither none mine shall heare bishop said madam trust refuse god word answered cannot tell call god word god word god word father dayes bishop said god word one time hath beene better vnderstood practised age others said durst eares haue auouched god word father dayes doe new book thanke god neuer read none neuer doe many bitter word forme religion established gouernment realme lawes made young yeares brother said bound obey vntill brother came perfect age affirmed would obey asked whether one priuie councell answered might well enough quoth councell goeth nowadayes concluded thanked gentlenesse come see offering preach thank neuer whit bishop brought sir thomas wharton vnto place dined desired drinke drunke looked sadly brake word surely haue done amisse haue drunke place god word hath beene offered refused whereas indeed beene mindfull duety ought haue stayed haue departed immediatly haue shaken dust feete testimony house touching disputation peter martyr martin bucer paulus phagius touching sacrament often handled book breuitie referre thee book large decease king edward yeare halfe death duke sommerset1553 king edward died entring seuenteenth yeare age seuenth yeare raigne time approached pleased almighty god call yong king v sixth day iuly three houres death eye closed speaking himselfe thinking none heard made prayer olloweth lord god deliuer miserable wretched life take amongst thy chosen howbeit thy done commit spirit vnto thee lord thou knowest happie thee yet thy chosen sake send life health may truly serue thes lord god blesse thy people saue thine inheritance lord saue thy chosen people england god defend realme papistrie maintain thy true religion people may prayse thy holy name thy sonne iesu christ sake turned face seeing said vnto nigh thought smilingly said praying god last word spake faint lord haue mercie vpon take spirit thus yeelded vp gh st leauing wofull kingdome behinde vnto sister tenth book wherein contained memorable thing done raigne queene mary king edward testament appoint lady iane daughter duke suffolk whose mother mary second sister king henry first wife french king said duke succeed kingdome councell chief nobilitie mayor london iudges chiefe lawyer sauing iudg hale subscribed therto stood q mary matter thus concluded king edward died sixteene yeares age said iane proclaymed queene london city age king edward learning wit might compared uniuersitie men haue taken many degree schooles queen mary wrote councel proclaime queen would pardon done answered diuorse betwixt king henry mother made illegitimate vnheritable crowne speeded selfe farre citie hoping vpon common whereupon councell sent forth duke northumberland lord gentleman armie guard assisting duke mary withdrew selfe capernaites taught christ body haue eaten teeth spake eating thereof christ said spirit quickeneth flesh profiteth nothing word spirit life see christ word must vnderstood spiritually literally hee commeth worthy supper must prepare iaw heart neither tooth belly beleeue saith saint augustine thou hast eaten wee must bring v spirituall hunger examine selues whether conscience doe testifie doe truely beleeue christ according scripture whereof truely certified beeing new borne old conuersation heart minde deed may boldly mariage garment faith come feast change bread still remaineth christ saith doe remembrance saint paul often shall eate bread drinke cup shall remember lord death vntill hee come heere change bread still christ saith except goe father comforter cannot come saint peter saith heauen shall keep vntill last day god euery hee man hee cannot one place body place hee heere hee graue woman sought angell said neither hee bethania lazarus died christ owne word thus conclude hunter abiure returne catholick church answered stand haue said said false doctrine beliefe beleeue christ true body sacrament onely heauen friendes kindred deceiued otherwise beleeued continue truth perswasions vsed vsed vnto also made answeres al ke neither flatterie threatning could bee brought truth cond mned carried essex bee burned william pigot burned braintree steuen knight burned mauld n stake kneeled downe said prayer lord iesu whose loue eaue life desire bitt r death losse earthly thing ather abide blasphemie thy name obay men breaking thy commandements might liue wealth worship false god chose rather torment body haue counted thing dung migh winns thee death dearer thousand gold siluer loue hast thou laide vp brest hu ger thee wounded deare de reth soy nd hy holy comforter commaunded set vpon blocke many iron put vpon leg might beare clarke told alexander maister philpot giuen man money alexander said man mony hath giuen searched tooke money said maister philpot good opinion election wee elected respect good workes long elected doe longer beleeued god infinite goodnesse iesus christ elect appoint foundation earth laid church congregation doth continually guide commission first day conducted richmond cl ded seruants souldiers appointed roomes giue attendance vpon person whereby shee dispaire life desired gentleman usher rest company pray gen leman usher desired lord tame tell danger meant toward mistris night saying certainely fellowes rather dye secretly miscarry lord tame answered rather men ready die foote also next day shee carried windsor way saw certaine men bad one goe say wordes tanquam ouis lay night deane windsor house next night shee brought maister dormer house many people presented vnto gift wherefore sir henry troubled poore people sore shewing kindnes vnto calling r bel traytors shee passed village townesmen rang bel ioy sir henry sent souldiers put gers stock otherwise misused othersome next night came lord tames house princely intreated noble men lady gentleman gentlewoman sir henry told could tell able answere doings lord tame said hee well aduised dooings grace might merry house sir henry whereas appointed grace chayre two cushion foote carpet princelike wherein presumptuo hee sate whilst bootes plucked wherefore lady gentlewoman laugh scorne next day brought woodstock inclosed tower threescore souldiers euery day warding within walles without fortie euery night without walles time imprisonment went garden walke shee fiue six locke locked vpon betwixt lodging walkes sir henry himselfe keeping keyes wherevpon shee called goaler desired call officer officer quoth good lord deliuer last earnes suite permitted write vnto queene sir henry stand whilest shee wrote hee straightly obserued wearie would carrie away letter bring againe called would haue messenger cartie letter would giue leaue said one owne men carry said e rowed none durst olde yes quoth shee haue none dishonest w willingly serue n w would permit letter carried foure fiue dayes writing therof fine sent gentl man demanding whether durst enterprise carrying letter queen answered yes durst would whereupon sir henrie halfe stomack gaue doctor owen doctor wendi e sent queen grace sickly ministred vnto let bloud tarrying day reported q councell grace behauior humblenes towards q maiestie took thankfully bishop rep ned told queen maruelled submitted selfe vnto maiesties mercie time grace requested secret friend submit selfe vnto queen would great commoditie answered would submit selfe vnto offended haue offended craue mercy law would cleere perrill mine e emies know selfe danger law time great consulting amongst bishop gentleman touching marriage grace spaniard wished stranger might goe realme portion lord said king neuer haue quiet commonwealth england except head striken shoulder spaniard answered god forbid king master consent mischiefe day spaniard neuer left good perswasions vnto king neuer obtaine like honour deliuering lady elizabeth prison whereby length happily released shortly sent hampton court sir henry benifield souldiers lord tame sir ralph chamberlaine guarding first night came ricot next dormer house colbrook lay george night came thither threescore gentleman yeoman met seene grace long season commanded queen name depart towne shee suffred speak night al men taken gentleman vsher three gentlewoman two groom one wardrop next day grace entred hampton court lay fortnightere euer recourse vnto length came lord william howard er vsed grace maruellous hanourably requested meane shee might speak councell long came gardner bishop winchester lord arundel lord shrewsbury secretary peter great humility humbled themselues vnto grace lord quoth glad see think haue bin kept great desolatly alone wherefore would desire meane king queen maiesties may deliuered prison wherein haue bin kept long space gardner kneeled requested submit selfe queen doubted maiestie would good vnto answerd rather would would lie prison dayes life adding craued mercy law euer offend maiesty thought word deed yeelding confesse selfe offendor neuer towards maiesty occasion wherof king queen might euer hereafter conceiue ill opinion therefore better lie prison tr th abroad suspected prince departed promising declare message que n next day gardner came vnto grace kneeling declared queen maruailed would stoutly vse selfe confessing haue offended seeme queen maiesty wrongfully haue imprisoned grace nay quoth queen may punish plea th nay quoth gardner maiesty willed certifie must tell another tale ere liberty grace answered liue prison honesty truth abroad suspected h r maiesty stand vnto neuer bely selfe kneeled said grace hath aduantage lord long imprisonment take god record quoth seeke vantage hand dealing kneeled downe desired grac might forgotten departed seuennight queen sent ten clocke night desired gentleman gentlewoman pray co ld tell whether euer se againe came vnto que ne kneeled downe desired god preserue maiestie wise doubting proue selfe true faithfull subiect towards maiestie euer therefore desired maiestie iudge said nd whatsoeuer report gone queen answered confesse offence b stand stoatly truth pray god may fall quoth desire fauour pardon maiesties hand wel said queene stiffely still perse ere truth belike confesse haue b ene wrongfully punished must say please grace said queene belike vnto others quoth haue borne burden must beare humbly beseech maiestie haue good opinion thinke true subiect hitherto long life lasteth parted comfortable word english said spanish god knoweth thought king philip behinde cloth seene shewed friend vnto matter thus grace went vnto lodging againe seuennight released sir henry benifield set colourably darkenes amongst heathen whose eies blinded perceiuing themselues deluded diuers vanity falshood speaketh darknes sheweth false thing true therefore v nothing done couertly none vnderstand
